gov.usgs.anss.utilinv

Class Query

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.usgs.anss.utilinv.Query

  • public class Query
extends java.lang.Object
    This can be used to manage a result set from a SQL query. The typical class that does the query must have a constructor of the for object(java.sql.ResultSet). This construtor must be declared public or it will not show up on the reflection list. This constructor is called from this class to create a array of objects of that class via getObjects(Class).

      Creates new Query using a existing connection and specified statement

    • Constructor Detail

      • Query

        public Query(java.sql.Connection Cin,
             java.lang.String in)
      throws java.sql.SQLException
        Creates new Query using a existing connection and specified statement
        Parameters:
        Cin - A MySQL JDBC connection
        in - String with the SQL command to execute (normally a SELECT).
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - Can be thrown if connection is bad, network down, or MySQL not running

    • Method Detail

      • getResultSet

        public java.sql.ResultSet getResultSet()
        return the ResultSet for this Query
        Returns:
        a ResultSet for this Query

      • getFields

        public java.util.ArrayList getFields()
        return an ArrayList with the fields of the Query
        Returns:
        An Array list with the fields from the Query

      • getObjects

        public java.util.ArrayList getObjects(java.lang.Class cl)
        This is so Cool! If you have a this object which controls a ResultSet in rs, this routine will return a ArrayList of objects of type cl(the argument). So if a query is run on Table Games with class Game the equivalent object, you call this to get n ArrayList of Games satisfying the query.
        Parameters:
        cl - The class on which objects should be built
        Returns:
        an Array list of objects of Class cl one for each row in ResultSet for this Query

      • updateObjects

        public int updateObjects()
        Update all of the objects created in this class via MySQL
        Returns:
        Number of rows in resultset (whether changed or not by this method)

      • getText

        public java.lang.String getText(java.lang.String delimiter)
        This builds a text from all of the columns of the current query. Reflection is used to get all of the columns titles. The result set is "rewound" and the entry set positioned creating a line of text for each row in the resultset
        Parameters:
        delimiter - This string is output between each field
        Returns:
        A string with title row followed by one text line for each row in resultSet

      • getNRows

        public int getNRows()
        return number of rows in results. Only valid after a call to getText() or getObjects()
        Returns:
        Number of returned rows

      • close

        public void close()
        we trap exceptions and just move on.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        This main converted fiekds in the umpire database when initially loaded. It is a good example of how to use the Query to get an ArrayList of objects from the database, change them and update them.
        Parameters:
        args - Unused
